<a href="http://cdn.piczend.com/images/6Rn5SRI2/1375635754_cover.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">http://cdn.piczend.com/images/6Rn5SRI2/1375635754_cover.jpg</a>

"Here's to Never Growing Up" is a song by Franco-Canadian recording artist Avril Lavigne. It was released as the lead single from her upcoming self-titled fifth studio album on April 9, 2013, by Epic Records. The song was written by Lavigne, David Hodges, Chad Kroeger, Jacob Kasher, and Martin Johnson, who also produced the track. In North America, Canada and Australia the song has since peaked at numbers 20, 17 and 15 so far in the Billboard Hot 100, Canadian Hot 100 and ARIA respectively.Directed by Robert Hales, with photography by Ketil Dietrichson and art direction by Lenny Tso. On April 8, 2013, Lavigne began shooting the music video for the song, the second day of the shooting was on April 19, confirmed by Lavigne on Twitter and the official premiere was on May 9. The video shows Lavigne playing with her band at a school during the Senior Prom. It also features scenes of Lavigne and her friends having a fun time at the school, eventually causing chaos. It also shows scenes of Lavigne singing in an empty classroom, that eventually shows all her friends dancing and having fun. The video makes allusions to Lavigne's first video for "Complicated", wearing the same outfit and skateboarding.
